snippet: As the U.S.T.A. begins searching for an executive to replace Patrick McEnroe, it seems best that the organization focuses on candidates who do not have nearly as much to learn when they step into the role.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column contends United States Tennis Association should seek an experienced candidate who can hit the ground running as it searches for a replacement for executive Patrick McEnroe.
lead_paragraph: As the U.S.T.A. begins searching for an executive to replace Patrick McEnroe, it seems best that the organization focuses on candidates who do not have nearly as much to learn when they step into the role.

headline.main: McEnroe’s Successor at U.S.T.A. Needs to Hit the Court Running
headline.print_headline: New U.S.T.A. Executive Needs to Hit the Court Running
